metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7074 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue has been found in PowerDNS before 3.4.11 and 4.0.2, and PowerDNS recursor before 4.0.4, allowing an attacker in position of man-in-the-middle to alter the content of an AXFR because of insufficient validation of TSIG signatures. A missing check that the TSIG record is the last one, leading to the possibility of parsing records that are not covered by the TSIG signature.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7074` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

pdns-backend-bind - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-geoip - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-ldap - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-lua - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-mydns - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-mysql - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-odbc - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-opendbx - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-pgsql - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-pipe - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-remote - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-sqlite3 - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-tinydns - 4.0.2-1
pdns-server - 4.0.2-1
pdns-tools - 4.0.2-1
No subscription required

pdns-recursor - 4.0.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pdns package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.2-1').
pdns-recursor package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.4-1').
